   20: 
   21: -module(ct_no_config_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: %% Note: This directive should only be used in test suites.
   24: -compile(export_all).
   25: 
   26: -include("ct.hrl").
   27: 
   28: %%% This suite is used to verify 2 things:
   29: %%%
   30: %%% 1) All hook pre/post functions get called, even if no init/end
   31: %%%    config functions exist in the suite (new from ver 1.6.1, R15B01).
   32: %%%
   33: %%% 2) The hook functions can read Config list elements, as well as
   34: %%%    required config variables, even if no init/end config
   35: %%%    functions exist. 
   36: 
   37: suite() ->
   38:     [{timetrap, {seconds,1}},
   39:      {ct_hooks, [verify_config_cth]},
   40:      {require,suite_cfg},
   41:      {default_config,suite_cfg,?MODULE}].
   42: 
   43: group(test_group) ->
   44:     [{require,group_cfg},
   45:      {default_config,group_cfg,test_group}].
   46: 
   47: test_case_1() ->    
   48:     [{require,test_case_1_cfg},
   49:      {default_config,test_case_1_cfg,test_case_1}].    
   50: 
   51: test_case_2() ->    
   52:     [{require,test_case_2_cfg},
   53:      {default_config,test_case_2_cfg,test_case_2}].    
   54: 
   55: all() ->
   56:     [test_case_1, {group,test_group}].
   57: 
   58: groups() ->
   59:     [{test_group,[],[test_case_2]}].
   60: 
   61: test_case_1(Config) ->
   62:     ok.
   63: 
   64: test_case_2(Config) ->
   65:     ok.
